{
  "health_issues": [
    {

      "cause": [

        "Irregular sleep schedule due to other factors.",
        "Stress and anxiety.",
        "Low physical activity."
      ],
      "severity": "moderate",
      "description": "Your reported sleep of 3 hours is significantly below the recommended amount. This can be linked to several factors including late-night stimulants (even energy drinks or occasional late coffee can disrupt your cycle), and high stress/anxiety levels. Lack of regular exercise also plays a role in sleep quality."
    },
    {
      "name": "Fatigue and low focus",
      "cause": [
        "Chronic sleep deprivation.",
        "Dehydration.",
        "Sedentary lifestyle.",
        "Potential nutrient deficiencies (though not directly assessed)."
      ],
      "severity": "high",
      "description": "Consistently getting only 3 hours of sleep will inevitably lead to daytime fatigue and reduced concentration. This is exacerbated by dehydration, a sedentary job, and potentially the cycle of energy drinks you use to cope."
    },
    {
      "name": "Dehydration and headaches",
      "cause": [
        "Insufficient fluid intake.",
        "Potential side effect of energy drinks.",
        "Stress.",
        "Low physical activity (can affect overall body function)."
      ],
      "severity": "moderate",
      "description": "Headaches are a common symptom of dehydration. It's crucial to ensure you're drinking enough water throughout the day, especially if you consume diuretics like caffeine (from energy drinks) or are under stress."
    },
    {
      "name": "Anxiety disorders and Stress-related disorders",
      "cause": [
        "Poor sleep quality and quantity.",
        "Sedentary lifestyle.",
        "Chronic fatigue.",
        "Potential hormonal imbalances due to stress.",
        "Lifestyle factors contributing to overall stress."
      ],
      "severity": "high",
      "description": "Mental health issues like anxiety and stress disorders are often intertwined with physical health. Lack of sleep, constant fatigue, and a sedentary lifestyle can significantly worsen these conditions. It's a cycle where poor physical health impacts mental well-being, and vice-versa."
    },
    {
      "name": "Bloating and stomach pain after heavy dinners",
      "cause": [
        "Digestive system overload.",
        "Dietary choices (heavy, potentially fatty or processed foods).",
        "Eating late at night.",
        "Stress affecting digestion.",
        "Lack of regular physical activity slowing digestion."
      ],
      "severity": "moderate",
      "description": "Your digestive system may be struggling to process large meals, especially if they are rich or consumed close to bedtime. A sedentary lifestyle and stress can further impair digestive function, leading to discomfort like bloating and pain."
    }
  ]
